subject: Law
title: Environmental Federalism
description: A fast breakdown of Environmental Federalism for builders.

hook.text: California sets stricter car emissions than the federal government. Can a state outdo Washington? Sometimes yes.

buildup.text: Environmental federalism divides regulatory power between federal and state governments.

discovery.text: Federal law often sets minimum standards. States can exceed them but generally cannot go below.

twist.text: California has a special Clean Air Act waiver letting it set its own vehicle emission rules. Other states can follow.

climax.text: When federal enforcement weakens, states become the primary defenders of environmental standards.

punchline.text: Two levels of government, one environment. The stricter rule often wins.

quiz.question: Can states set stricter environmental standards than federal law?
options: Yes, states can exceed federal minimums
